whaleFacts.question: what do whales eat?
whaleFacts.fact: Baleen whales (with big comb bristles for teeth) eat Plankton, Krill and other crustaceans. Whilst toothed Whales eat squid and fish as well.

whaleFacts.question: How big is a Blue Whale?
whaleFacts.fact: It is as long as 30 meters, which is 3 big buses! Their heart is as big as a small car too

whaleFacts.question: Do whales sing?
whaleFacts.fact: Whale sounds are called songs and some are heard hundreds of miles away underwater and are much louder than Jet planes!

whaleFacts.question: Whales breathe air
whaleFacts.fact: They have lungs like us and so have to hold their breath underwater. They come to the surface to take another breath!

whaleFacts.question: How far do whales travel?
whaleFacts.fact: Whales migrate thousands of miles to find food and have babies. They can be found all around the Earth's oceans.

whaleFacts.question: Is there a unicorn whale?!
whaleFacts.fact: The Narwhal has a great big tusk on its head which looks like a spiral. It really exists and live in the Arctic!

whaleFacts.question: Some whales can hold their breath for over an hour
whaleFacts.fact: This helps them dive deep in the ocean to search for food or explore!

whaleFacts.question: Baby whales are called calves
whaleFacts.fact: They drink their mother’s milk and stay close to her when young.

whaleFacts.question: Toothed whales use echolocation
whaleFacts.fact: They send out sounds to bounce off objects and “see” underwater!

axolotlFacts.question: Axolotls live in water
axolotlFacts.fact: They live their whole lives in water and even keep their gills, which stick out like feathery branches on their heads.

axolotlFacts.question: They are amazing healers
axolotlFacts.fact: If an axolotl gets hurt, it can regrow body parts like legs and even bits of its heart or brain!

axolotlFacts.question: Where do they live?
axolotlFacts.fact: Axolotls come from lakes in Mexico, but their natural homes are disappearing, so people are helping protect them.

axolotlFacts.question: Are they colourful?
axolotlFacts.fact: Pet Axolotls are usually pink. Some axolotls are brown like mud, while others are pink, white, or even golden.

axolotlFacts.question: Axolotls are not fish!
axolotlFacts.fact: Even though they live in water, axolotls are actually amphibians, like frogs and salamanders.

axolotlFacts.question: What is an Axolotl's favourite meal?
axolotlFacts.fact: Earthworms! They also like to eat insects and small fish too.

axolotlFacts.question: Why do axolotls always look like they're smiling?
axolotlFacts.fact: Their mouths are shaped in a way that makes them look cheerful!

axolotlFacts.question: They stay babies forever!
axolotlFacts.fact: Axolotls never fully grow up—this is called neoteny.

axolotlFacts.question: What are 'water monsters'?
axolotlFacts.fact: Axolotls earned this nickname because of their unusual, ancient look!

catFacts.question: Cats sleep a lot
catFacts.fact: They can nap up to 16 hours a day—that’s like being a professional sleeper!

catFacts.question: They have super senses
catFacts.fact: Cats can hear sounds too high for humans and see well in almost total darkness.

catFacts.question: Which cat is the fastest?
catFacts.fact: The Cheetah is the fastest cat and land animal on the planet! It can reach speeds of 60mph!

catFacts.question: Where do they live?
catFacts.fact: Cats can be found everywhere, like the Snow Leopard - it lives in the Himalayan mountains!

catFacts.question: How long have people been keeping cats?
catFacts.fact: Ancient Egyptians praised cats but evidence tells us we had them as pets for more than 10,000 years.

catFacts.question: Why do cats hate water?
catFacts.fact: This is not true amongst all cats - the Tiger, Jaguar and Leopard all love to swim!

catFacts.question: Cats use whiskers to measure space
catFacts.fact: They help cats know if they can fit into tight places!

catFacts.question: Cats purr to relax and maybe even heal
catFacts.fact: Some scientists believe purring helps cats feel better when they’re sick or hurt.

catFacts.question: Kittens open their eyes after birth
catFacts.fact: It takes about 7–10 days before a kitten opens its eyes for the first time.

penguinFacts.question: Where do they live
penguinFacts.fact: Only Emperor and Adele penguins live in the Antarctic! They spend lots of time at sea, finding food too.

penguinFacts.question: How deep can an Adele dive?
penguinFacts.fact: Adele penguins are super divers! They easily swim to 150m below the surface, which is as long as three Olympic swimming pools.

penguinFacts.question: What do they eat?
penguinFacts.fact: Most penguins eat fish and they sometimes spend days at sea gathering food for their family.

penguinFacts.question: How do they fly?
penguinFacts.fact: No penguin can fly! Instead we call the wings flippers and they zoom around the water instead.

penguinFacts.question: They talk with squawks and dancing
penguinFacts.fact: Penguins use sounds and moves to recognize each other and say “hi!

penguinFacts.question: How do they keep warm in the snow?
penguinFacts.fact: Penguins huddle together to share heat and fluff their feathers to keep the heat in their feathery coats.

penguinFacts.question: Penguins can jump from the water like rockets!
penguinFacts.fact: They zoom upwards quickly when swimming fast—it’s very fun to watch!

penguinFacts.question: Penguins slide on their bellies
penguinFacts.fact: It’s called tobogganing and helps them move fast across icy lands.

penguinFacts.question: Penguin parents share egg-warming duties
penguinFacts.fact: Mum and dad take turns keeping their egg snug in the cold.

whaleQuestions.question: How big is a Blue Whale?
whaleQuestions.answerTwo: The same size as a Giraffe

whaleQuestions.question: How loud are whales?
whaleQuestions.answerOne: As loud as a person shouting
whaleQuestions.answerTwo: As loud as a roaring Lion

penguinQuestions.answerThree: As deep as 3 Olympic swimming pools end to end
penguinQuestions.correctAnswer: As deep as 3 Olympic swimming pools end to end
